meanings.sent1: The old clock had a ticky sound that could be heard throughout the house.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the ticky noise of the rain hitting the window.
meanings.sent3: The ticky clock kept me up all night with its constant ticking.
meanings.sent4: The ticky sound of the clock echoed in the empty room, creating a sense of loneliness.
meanings.sent5: The ticky noise of the clock became a comforting lullaby as I drifted off to sleep.

meanings.definition: Showing a tendency to change suddenly or frequently
meanings.sent1: Her mood was quite ticky, shifting from happy to sad in a matter of minutes.
meanings.sent2: The weather in spring can be quite ticky, going from sunny to rainy in an instant.
meanings.sent3: His ticky behavior kept everyone on their toes, never knowing what to expect next.
meanings.sent4: The ticky nature of the stock market made it difficult to predict future trends.
meanings.sent5: The ticky emotions of the character made the story unpredictable and exciting.

meanings.sent1: The ticky old chair collapsed as soon as he sat on it.
meanings.sent2: The house was filled with ticky furniture that needed to be replaced.
meanings.sent3: She tried to fix the ticky door, but it kept getting stuck.
meanings.sent4: The ticky car barely made it down the street before breaking down.
meanings.sent5: The ticky quality of the product was evident in its cheap materials and construction.
